playn.core.canvas

Class CanvasSurface

  • java.lang.Object
    • playn.core.canvas.CanvasSurface
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Surface

    public class CanvasSurface
extends Object
implements Surface
    Implementation class, to be used by platforms that implement Surface as just a special case of Canvas.

      • drawImageCentered

        public Surface drawImageCentered(Image image,
                        float dx,
                        float dy)
        Description copied from interface: Surface
        Draws an image, centered at the specified location. Simply subtracts image.width/2 from dx and image.height/2 from dy.
        Specified by:
        drawImageCentered in interface Surface
        Parameters:
        image - the image to draw
        dx - destination x
        dy - destination y

      • drawLayer

        public Surface drawLayer(Layer layer)
        Description copied from interface: Surface
        Renders the supplied scene graph into this surface. This renders the scene graph into the surface's texture using the main render pipeline, so custom shaders (on platforms that support them) are handled properly. NOTE: if there is a loop in the scene graph (like you add an ImmediateLayer that calls surf.drawLayer(graphics().rootLayer())) you will get the infinite loop that you deserve. Caveat renderer.
        Specified by:
        drawLayer in interface Surface

      • fillTriangles

        public Surface fillTriangles(float[] xys,
                    int[] indices)
        Description copied from interface: Surface
        Fills the supplied batch of triangles with the current fill color or pattern. Note: this method is only performant on OpenGL-based backends (Android, iOS, HTML-WebGL, etc.). On non-OpenGL-based backends (HTML-Canvas, HTML-Flash) it converts the triangles to a path on every rendering call.
        Specified by:
        fillTriangles in interface Surface
        Parameters:
        xys - the xy coordinates of the triangles, as an array: [x1, y1, x2, y2, ...].
        indices - the index of each vertex of each triangle in the xys array.

      • fillTriangles

        public Surface fillTriangles(float[] xys,
                    float[] sxys,
                    int[] indices)
        Description copied from interface: Surface
        Fills the supplied batch of triangles with the current fill pattern. Note: this method only honors the texture coordinates on OpenGL-based backends (Anrdoid, iOS, HTML-WebGL, etc.). On non-OpenGL-based backends (HTML-Canvas, HTML-Flash) it behaves like a call to Surface.fillTriangles(float[],int[]).
        Specified by:
        fillTriangles in interface Surface
        Parameters:
        xys - the xy coordinates of the triangles, as an array: [x1, y1, x2, y2, ...].
        sxys - the texture coordinates for each vertex of the triangles, as an array: [sx1, sy1, sx2, sy2, ...]. This must be the same length as xys.
        indices - the index of each vertex of each triangle in the xys array.

      • setAlpha

        public Surface setAlpha(float alpha)
        Description copied from interface: Surface
        Set the alpha component of this surface's current tint. Note that this value will be quantized to an integer between 0 and 255. Also see Surface.setTint(int).

        Values outside the range [0,1] will be clamped to the range [0,1].

        Specified by:
        setAlpha in interface Surface
        Parameters:
        alpha - value in range [0,1] where 0 is transparent and 1 is opaque.

      • setTint

        public Surface setTint(int tint)
        Description copied from interface: Surface
        Sets the tint for this layer, as ARGB.

        NOTE: this will overwrite any value configured via Surface.setAlpha(float). Either include your desired alpha in the high bits of tint or call Surface.setAlpha(float) after calling this method.

        NOTE: the RGB components of a layer's tint only work on GL-based backends. It is not possible to tint layers using the HTML5 canvas and Flash backends.

        Specified by:
        setTint in interface Surface

      • setFillColor

        public Surface setFillColor(int color)
        Description copied from interface: Surface
        Sets the color to be used for fill operations. This replaces any existing fill gradient or pattern.
        Specified by:
        setFillColor in interface Surface

      • setFillPattern

        public Surface setFillPattern(Pattern pattern)

        Sets the pattern to be used for fill operations. This replaces any existing fill gradient or pattern.
        Specified by:
        setFillPattern in interface Surface

      • setShader

        public Surface setShader(GLShader shader)
        Description copied from interface: Surface
        Configures a custom shader to use when drawing images and shapes to this surface. If the supplied shader is null, the default shader will be used.
        Specified by:
        setShader in interface Surface
